headline: Association for Financial Professionals Welcomed 178 New Certified Corporate FP&A Professionals in 2025
summary: The Association for Financial Professionals (AFP) welcomed 178 new Certified Corporate FP&A Professional (FPAC) credential holders in 2025. The class of newly designated FPACs includes finance professionals from Fortune 500 companies such as Amazon, PepsiCo, Verizon Communications and Ecolab.

headline: Strength Seen in Array Digital (AD): Can Its 6.6% Jump Turn into More Strength?
summary: Array Digital (AD) witnessed a jump in share price last session on above-average trading volume. The latest trend in earnings estimate revisions for the stock doesn't suggest further strength down the road.

headline: Verizon Issues $20 Credits to Customers Affected by Outage
summary: “Yesterday, we did not meet the standard of excellence our customers expect and that we expect of ourselves,” Verizon said in a statement Thursday morning.  The company is offering $20 account credits, which should cover “multiple days of service.”  People began noticing service disruptions shortly before noon in New York, according to Downdetector.

content.title: Verizon Issues $20 Credits to Customers Affected by Outage

headline: Massive Corporate Layoffs Changed Everything, Says Robert Kiyosaki. Calls Going To School For Job Security An 'Obsolete Idea'
summary: Robert Kiyosaki says the recent wave of corporate job cuts shows that the traditional promise of stability through schooling no longer holds up in today's economy. In a recent post on X, the investor and author of “Rich Dad Poor Dad” argued that going to school for job security has become an “obsolete idea,” especially as layoffs hit industries that once symbolized safety, prestige, and high pay. His comments come amid continued workforce reductions across logistics, retail, manufacturing, and t

headline: Verizon offers $20 credit post-outage, ASML hits $500B market cap
summary: Market Domination host Josh Lipton and Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma take a look at some of Thursday's trending tickers and stories. ASML Holding (ASML) stock is moving higher as it reached a $500 billion market capitalization. Reddit (RDDT) stock is under pressure after the company received mixed feedback from RBC analysts. Verizon (VZ) is offering a $20 credit to customers who were affected by Wednesday's widespread outage. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

content.title: Verizon offers $20 credit post-outage, ASML hits $500B market cap
content.description:
Market Domination host Josh Lipton and Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma take a look at some of Thursday's trending tickers and stories.

ASML Holding (ASML) stock is moving higher as it reached a $500 billion market capitalization.

Reddit (RDDT) stock is under pressure after the company received mixed feedback from RBC analysts.

Verizon (VZ) is offering a $20 credit to customers who were affected by Wednesday's widespread outage.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Verizon and Frontier Receive All Required Regulatory Approvals to Complete Transaction
summary: Receipt of California regulatory approval on January 15, 2026 clears path to close transaction on January 20, 2026Approved transaction is expected to expand fiber access to almost 30 million homes and businesses and accelerate Verizon’s national mobility and broadband convergence strategy Best mobile and home offers are expected to be available for customers after closing BASKING RIDGE, N.J. and DALLAS, Jan. 15, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Verizon Communications Inc. (NYSE, Nasdaq: VZ) ("Verizon")

headline: California approves Verizon acquisition of Frontier, clearing way for closing
summary: The California Public Utilities Commission on Thursday approved Verizon Communications'  $20 billion deal to acquire fiber-optic internet providers Frontier Communications , clearing the way for ​the deal to close on Tuesday after Verizon agreed to a series of conditions.  California ‌state regulators said Verizon committed to investing in 75,000 new fiber locations and building 25 new wireless towers to expand ‌service in rural areas in the state.  “The path to closing the Frontier acquisition marks ⁠a significant milestone in Verizon's ‌evolution and is a bold step forward in Verizon's transformation to regain market leadership,” said Verizon CEO Dan Schulman.

content.title: California approves Verizon acquisition of Frontier, clearing way for closing
content.summary: The California Public Utilities Commission on Thursday approved Verizon Communications'  $20 billion deal to acquire fiber-optic internet providers Frontier Communications , clearing the way for ​the deal to close on Tuesday after Verizon agreed to a series of conditions.  California ‌state regulators said Verizon committed to investing in 75,000 new fiber locations and building 25 new wireless towers to expand ‌service in rural areas in the state.  “The path to closing the Frontier acquisition marks ⁠a significant milestone in Verizon's ‌evolution and is a bold step forward in Verizon's transformation to regain market leadership,” said Verizon CEO Dan Schulman.
